item.title: By: K
item.dc:creator: K
item.description:
Yeah, nice that it is finally embeddable. It really is well done and fits the song quite nicely.
I'll have to give Sophtware another listen. My old roommate was a fan of Grandaddy and I tried to get in to them, but it never happened.
item.content:encoded:
Yeah, nice that it is finally embeddable. It really is well done and fits the song quite nicely.

I’ll have to give Sophtware another listen. My old roommate was a fan of Grandaddy and I tried to get in to them, but it never happened.

item.title: By: Kevin Langston
item.dc:creator: Kevin Langston
item.description:
Yeah, I've had the page bookmarked for years, but if memory serves, it's been only recently that Smith has provided an embedding code.
Plus, I just haven't had a blog, y'see, to share it with.
I'm rather fond of <i>The Sophtware Slump</i>. I think it's Grandaddy's master stroke (ooh, hush).
item.content:encoded:
Yeah, I’ve had the page bookmarked for years, but if memory serves, it’s been only recently that Smith has provided an embedding code.

Plus, I just haven’t had a blog, y’see, to share it with.

I’m rather fond of The Sophtware Slump. I think it’s Grandaddy’s master stroke (ooh, hush).

item.title: By: K
item.dc:creator: K
item.description: The only song by Grandaddy that I like. I tried them all. This vids been floating around for years now. One of the times when a fan created work is accepted and used by the band instead of the creator having his/her pants sued off them by the Label.
item.content:encoded: The only song by Grandaddy that I like. I tried them all. This vids been floating around for years now. One of the times when a fan created work is accepted and used by the band instead of the creator having his/her pants sued off them by the Label.
